ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Re: cantera 1.7.1

Sergey,

The bugs you found have now been fixed, and the CVS repository  
updated.  Please let me know if there are still any problems.

Dave


On May 11, 2007, at 10:13 AM, scheskis wrote:

> Hello David,
> I successfully installed Cantera 1.7.1 on suse 10.2 both 32 and 64
> bit. At the moment I have checked only the matlab demo.
> Some problems:
> 1. I was need to turn off "boost" option. They was on in CVS version
> which I downloaded today. In spite that I have boost instaled it gaves
> the following error:
>
> g++ -pthread -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.5/src/pycantera.o
> -L/home/sergey/src/cantera171/cantera/build/lib/x86_64-unknown- 
> linux-gnu
> -L/usr/lib64 -L/home/sergey/sundials/lib -L/usr/local/lib
> -L/usr/lib/python2.5/config -lclib -luser -loneD -lzeroD -lequil
> -lkinetics -ltransport -lthermo -lctnumerics -lsundials_cvodes
> -lsundials_nvecserial -lctbase -llapack -lblas -lctmath -ltpx -lctf2c
> -lconverters -lboost_thread-mt-1_34 -lctf2c -lctf2c -lm -lpython2.5 -o
> build/lib.linux-x86_64-2.5/Cantera/_cantera.so
> /usr/lib64/gcc/x86_64-suse-linux/4.1.2/../../../../x86_64-suse- 
> linux/bin/ld:
> cannot find -lboost_thread-mt-1_34
> collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
>
> 2. It is possible to compile only with f2c option. Using g77 or
> gfortran  gives undefined symbols: printstring_ for g77
> or_gfortran_stop_numeric.
>
> 3. Problem with f2c was in the 64 bit version: I was needed to add
> manually -fPIC in CFLAGS in all makefiles in etc subdirectories:
> f2c_math, f2c_lapack, etc. There is probably the better way to do it.
> But after this change all is working.
>
> Regards
> Sergey.
>
>
>
> --- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>>
>> Cantera 1.7.1 is ready to be checked out from CVS for unix/linux/Mac
>> users. It is probably best to check out a fresh working copy, rather
>> than update an existing one. The new features are:
>>
>> 1. Thread safe build option.  Cantera can optionally be built to be
>> thread safe, which insures that static data (e.g. cached error
>> messages) are modified by only one thread at a time. This option
>> requires the Boost thread library (which is why it is not the
>> default).  You can download Boost from www.boost.org.
>>
>> 2. Faster chemical equilibrium. The equilibrium routines were
>> spending quite a bit of time writing detailed logfiles. Now this can
>> be turned off, or completely compiled out of the code.
>>
>> Both of these options may be set in the preconfig script. Please
>> report any build problems with this new version.
>>
>
>
>
>
>

>
